oai_dc:dc.dc:title: K.K.K.K. CELEBRATION
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: K.K.K.K. CELEBRATION [Knoxville Ku Klux Klan or Knights of the Ku Klux Klan]. LABOR DAY MONDAY, SEPTEMBER 7, 1925 KNOXVILLE, TENN. Thousands of Klansmen in Robes will stage one of the largest parades ever held in the old Volunteer State OPEN AIR NATURALIZATION CEREMONY LARGE PYROTECHNIC DISPLAY (With All the Latest Novelties in Fireworks) WHERE? CASWELL PARK-Gates Open at 7:45 P. M. Ephemera 2013.001.002
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Holidays; Fireworks; Organizations; Ku Klux Klan;
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814.
